Casey Affleck graces the screen as an enigma whom is once deciphered proved to be the epitome of grief The film s uneventfulness and the inclusion of the much appreciated mundane humor -- props to Affleck and Hedges exchanges -- serve nothing but a facade to its overarching theme of pain and me lancholy Manchester by the Sea s sucker punch like flashbacks may need some time to get used to but overall its somber yet constantly endearing nature will keep you lured throughout.

Through the main character s eyes we get to see how depression truly effects us when t here's a constant feeling of hopeless. Casey Affleck I never thought much about him until now His performance in this movie was very subtle and emotionless But that s what made his character so intriguing. Throughout the movie we get to see the main character Lee s everyday life What the world looks like through his eyes and how gloomy it all is Much like the setting of Manchester too. There are moment where the movie cuts back and forth from the past to the present and vice versa It takes a few seconds to notice which timeline your in But that s what I loved about it. Lee is a different person in the past and in the present In the past he s a happy humorous guy But in the present he s sad and moody and often doesn't say muc h.. So it always leaves you to wonder What happened to him ?". More so as the scenes progresses you get keys of information as to what happened to him. The progression of the scenes building and the performances as well as the somber look of Manchester is what I loved about this movie. Lee s character is a bit unlikable at times his awkward ness got on my nerves and he s kind of mean to people at times. His nephew played by Lucas Hedges on the c ontrary was hilarious and I liked his interplay with Lee. The pacing is a bit slow and drawn out but if you like indie movies and movies where you get to see everyday life unfold watch this You won t be disappointed.
